cards.name: Electrolyze

rulings.text: You divide the damage as you cast Electrolyze, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage. In other words, as you cast Electrolyze, you choose whether to have it deal 2 damage to a single target, or deal 1 damage to each of two targets.
If Electrolyze targets two creatures and one becomes an illegal target, the remaining target is dealt 1 damage, not 2. You’ll still draw a card.
If all chosen targets are illegal as Electrolyze tries to resolve, it won’t resolve and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be dealt and you won’t draw a card.

cards.text:
Electrolyze deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two targets.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind

rulings.text: If a spell or ability causes you to draw multiple cards, Niv-Mizzet’s ability triggers that many times.

If dealing 1 damage to a permanent or player causes you to draw a card, perhaps because Niv-Mizzet is enchanted by Curiosity, you’ll continue this loop until the loop is interrupted, perhaps by a player losing the game.

cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you draw a card, Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind deals 1 damage to any target.
{T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Rakdos Guildmage

rulings.text: If the second ability is activated during the End step, the token won’t be exiled until the following turn’s End step.

cards.text:
({B/R} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
{3}{B}, Discard a card: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
{3}{R}: Create a 2/1 red Goblin creature token with haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Voidslime

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.text: Counter target spell, activated ability, or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

cards.name: Urza's Factory

rulings.text: Although Urza’s Factory has the Urza’s land type, it doesn’t interact with Urza’s Tower, Urza’s Mine, or Urza’s Power Plant.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{7}, {T}: Create a 2/2 colorless Assembly-Worker artifact creature token.

cards.name: Serra Avenger

rulings.text: You can cast Serra Avenger during another player’s first, second, or third turns of the game if some other effect (such as Vedalken Orrery) enables that.
Serra Avenger cares about how many turns you have taken, not necessarily how many turns the game has had, in case you take an extra turn.
If the game is restarted (by Karn Liberated), you can’t cast Serra Avenger in your first, second, or third turn in the new game.

cards.text:
You can't cast this spell during your first, second, or third turns of the game.
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Black Knight.

cards.name: Groundbreaker

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Ball Lightning.
The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

cards.text:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Groundbreaker.

cards.name: Imperious Perfect
cards.text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

cards.name: Doran, the Siege Tower

rulings.text: Doran’s ability means, for example, that a 2/3 creature will assign 3 damage in combat instead of 2.
Doran’s ability doesn’t actually change creatures’ power; it changes only the value of the combat damage they assign. All other rules and effects that check power or toughness use the real values.
This effect is mandatory and affects all creatures.

cards.text: Each creature assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power.

cards.name: Bramblewood Paragon

rulings.text: If a Warrior would normally enter the battlefield with a certain number of +1/+1 counters on it, it enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters plus one on it instead. If a Warrior would normally enter the battlefield with no +1/+1 counters on it, it enters the battlefield with one +1/+1 counter on it instead.

The creature gets the counter if it would enter the battlefield under your control. It doesn’t matter who owns the creature or what zone it enters the battlefield from (such as your opponent’s graveyard, for example).

The effects from more than one Bramblewood Paragon are cumulative. That is, if you have more than one Bramblewood Paragon on the battlefield, Warrior creatures you control enter the battlefield with that many additional +1/+1 counters on them.
If Bramblewood Paragon enters the battlefield at the same time as another Warrior (due to Living End, for example), that creature doesn’t get a +1/+1 counter.

cards.text:
Each other Warrior creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.

cards.name: Mutavault

rulings.text: Although Mutavault has all creature types while it’s animated, it does not have the changeling keyword ability.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.
Examples of creature types include Sliver, Goblin, and Soldier. Creature types appear after the dash on the type line of creatures.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}: Mutavault becomes a 2/2 creature with all creature types until end of turn. It's still a land.
